definition[0]: to sit or lie down in a relaxed way, by letting all your weight fall heavily onto a chair etc
example[0]: He flopped down onto the bed.
example[1]: I got home and flopped in front of the TV.
definition[1]: to hang or fall loosely, in an uncontrolled way
definition[2]: if something such as a product, play, or idea flops, it is not successful because people do not like it
definition[3]: a film, play, product etc that is not successful
example[3]: The film was a complete flop.
definition[4]: the movement or noise that something makes when it falls heavily
example[4]: He fell with a flop into the water.
definition[5]: if a product or an attempt to do something flops, it fails completely
example[5]: A £16 million rights issue in the company flopped yesterday with only 2.4 % of the 151 million shares on offer taken up.
example[6]: Some members of the board pointed out that many of sales director’s schemes have flopped.
